Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the nature of the INSIGHT study as detailed in the consent form?
A) The study is a routine medical check-up with no research components.
B) The study is a commercial survey to assess patient satisfaction with hospital services.
C) The study is a research trial investigating the effectiveness of chemotherapy versus endocrine therapy in HR+ metastatic breast cancer.
D) The study is a non-research educational program about breast cancer awareness.

Correct answer: C) The study is a research trial investigating the effectiveness of chemotherapy versus endocrine therapy in HR+ metastatic breast cancer.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
Questions:
What is the primary goal of the INSIGHT research study?
A) To compare the effectiveness of physical therapy versus chemotherapy in breast cancer patients; B) To determine if early chemotherapy can prevent tumor growth better than standard endocrine therapy in HR+ metastatic breast cancer; C) To test the efficacy of a new surgical procedure for breast cancer; D) To evaluate the impact of dietary changes on breast cancer progression

Correct answer: B

Topics: The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
For how long will participants be expected to undergo wellness checks after stopping the treatment in this study?
A) Up to 1 year; B) Up to 2 years; C) Up to 5 years; D) Indefinitely

Correct answer: C) Up to 5 years

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding the costs to the subject for participating in the INSIGHT study?

A) Subjects will be compensated for their time and any expenses incurred during the study.
B) Subjects will be responsible for the costs of treatments and tests that are part of their usual cancer care, which will be billed to them or their insurance.
C) Subjects will have to pay for the research-only procedures such as research blood tests and patient surveys.
D) Subjects will be billed for all medical care, including treatments and tests that are being done only for research purposes.

Correct answer: B) Subjects will be responsible for the costs of treatments and tests that are part of their usual cancer care, which will be billed to them or their insurance.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
What is the correct sequence of procedures a participant will undergo after being confirmed eligible for the INSIGHT study?

A) Randomization into study groups, treatment with either endocrine-based therapy or chemotherapy, regular clinical exams, and blood tests.
B) Treatment with chemotherapy only, followed by randomization into study groups, and then regular clinical exams.
C) Initial tumor test to determine Luminal A or non-Luminal A status, followed by randomization, treatment, and regular clinical exams and blood tests.
D) Regular clinical exams and blood tests, followed by treatment with endocrine-based therapy, and then randomization into study groups.

Correct answer: C) Initial tumor test to determine Luminal A or non-Luminal A status, followed by randomization, treatment, and regular clinical exams and blood tests.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Questions:
What should you do if you decide to withdraw from the INSIGHT study, and how will it affect your future medical care?

A) You must continue in the study until it is completed; otherwise, you will lose access to all medical care at Vanderbilt University Medical Center.
B) You should inform your study doctor about your decision to withdraw, and your standard medical care will continue without any penalties.
C) Withdrawing from the study will result in a financial penalty, and you will be billed for all study-related treatments received up to that point.
D) If you withdraw from the study, you will not be allowed to participate in any other clinical trials in the future.

Correct answer: B

Topics: Identification of any procedures which are experimental
Questions:
Which of the following treatments being studied in the INSIGHT research is considered experimental for the treatment of non-luminal A hormone receptor-positive (HR+) metastatic breast cancer?
A) Standard endocrine therapy as chosen by your doctor
B) Capecitabine chemotherapy after tumors have grown on endocrine therapy
C) Capecitabine chemotherapy as an initial treatment option
D) Routine blood tests for organ function and safety

Correct answer: C

Topics: The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many participants will be enrolled in the INSIGHT study for the treatment of HR+ metastatic breast cancer?
A) 50 participants; B) 100 participants; C) 150 participants; D) The number of participants is not specified in the consent form.
Correct answer: D) The number of participants is not specified in the consent form.

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential risk or discomfort associated with participating in the INSIGHT study?

A) Temporary discomfort from blood sample collection
B) Permanent hair loss due to chemotherapy
C) Immediate cure of the metastatic breast cancer
D) Guaranteed financial compensation for participation

Correct answer: A

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
What are the potential benefits of participating in the INSIGHT study for individuals with HR+ metastatic breast cancer?

A) Participants may receive a new, experimental treatment that is not yet FDA-approved for any condition.
B) Participants may contribute to medical knowledge that could improve treatment options for future patients with a similar type of breast cancer.
C) Participants will receive financial compensation for contributing to the advancement of breast cancer treatment.
D) Participants are guaranteed to have their breast cancer cured by the end of the study.

Correct answer: B) Participants may contribute to medical knowledge that could improve treatment options for future patients with a similar type of breast cancer.

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
Questions:
If you decide not to participate in the INSIGHT study, what alternative treatment options are available to you?
A) You may receive a different type of chemotherapy not mentioned in the study; B) You will be offered the standard endocrine-based therapy for your condition; C) You will not receive any treatment for your metastatic breast cancer; D) You will be enrolled in a different research study automatically.

Correct answer: B

Topics: A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes how your confidentiality will be maintained if you participate in the INSIGHT study?
A) Your personal information will be shared publicly to promote the study.
B) Your personal information will be kept confidential, but may be shared with certain individuals and organizations for study oversight and quality assurance.
C) Your personal information will be used for marketing purposes by the study sponsors.
D) Your confidentiality is not a concern for this study, and no measures will be taken to protect it.

Correct answer: B

Topics: For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
What is the policy regarding compensation for any injury that may occur as a result of participating in the INSIGHT study?

A) Participants will receive free medical treatment for any injuries directly caused by the study.
B) Participants may be billed for the cost of medical care provided at Vanderbilt to treat the injury, and are responsible for any copayments or deductibles.
C) Participants will receive a fixed monetary compensation for any injuries.
D) All medical costs associated with injuries sustained during the study will be covered by the study's insurance.

Correct answer: B) Participants may be billed for the cost of medical care provided at Vanderbilt to treat the injury, and are responsible for any copayments or deductibles.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject
Questions:
If you experience an injury as a result of participating in the INSIGHT study, whom should you contact for assistance?
A) The Institutional Review Board Office; B) The Principal Investigator, Dr. Sonya Reid; C) The Vanderbilt Financial Assistance Program; D) Your personal physician
Correct answer: B) The Principal Investigator, Dr. Sonya Reid

Topics: A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What are your rights regarding participation in the INSIGHT study for HR+ MBC treatment?

A) You are required to participate in the study once you have been informed about it.
B) You may choose not to participate or to stop participating at any time without any impact on your usual care or legal rights.
C) Refusal to participate will result in a loss of medical benefits or services you are currently entitled to.
D) Discontinuing participation in the study will result in a penalty or loss of benefits you are entitled to outside of the study.

Correct answer: B) You may choose not to participate or to stop participating at any time without any impact on your usual care or legal rights.
